intro: Ida munaensis, commonly known as the Muna island bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Muna. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Ida munaensis has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth surface and produces small, fragrant blossoms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
